benchmark_details.name: Nano-ESG
benchmark_details.overview: Nano-ESG is a novel dataset that extracts corporate sustainability information from over 840,000 news articles concerning major German companies, summarizing the articles and determining ESG-related sentiment and aspects using Large Language Models (LLMs).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide an independent way to analyze corporate sustainability practices through the aggregation of ESG-related information from news articles.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset may struggle with articles containing conflicting sentiments and those related to multiple companies.

data.source: Collected from popular online media sources in Germany and English news outlets.
data.annotation: Summarized and annotated using LLMs with evaluation from sustainability experts.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on expert evaluations comparing LLM outputs with human annotations.
methodology.interpretation: Good performance is indicated by high agreement rates among human annotators for summaries and sentiment.
methodology.baseline_results: LLM annotations achieved an accuracy of 79.9% for sentiment and 78.5% for aspect determination.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures included human evaluations of a subset of the dataset.
